clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Precise Aerosol Inhalation Nursing on Sputum Excretion in Elderly Patients With Lung Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Study on the Effect of Precise Aerosol Inhalation Nursing Program on Effective Sputum Excretion in Elderly Patients With Lung Surgery

lead_sponsor.agency: The First Affiliated Hospital of Soochow University

clinical_study.source: The First Affiliated Hospital of Soochow University

brief_summary.textblock: Comparing the effects of different kinds of aerosol inhalation nursing programs on effective sputum excretion in elderly patients with lung surgery.

detailed_description.textblock: Based on the traditional oxygen aerosol inhalation treatment, this study will improve it. In the process, precise body position care, time control, observation and treatment, evaluation, etc. will be used to form a precise aerosol inhalation care plan. To explore the effect of this program on effective sputum excretion in elderly patients undergoing lung surgery.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From the first to the third day after surgery.
primary_outcome.description: The investigators use a self-made inhalation implementation standard evaluation form to evaluate whether inhalation was standard in postoperative patients.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the first to the third day after surgery.
secondary_outcome.description: Discomfort during inhalation: chest tightness, dyspnea, palpitations, elevated blood pressure, etc.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the first to the third day after surgery.
secondary_outcome.description: According to the viscosity, the sputum was divided into three types: ⅰ degree (thin phlegm), ⅱ degree (moderate phlegm), ⅲ degree (severe phlegm).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the first to the third day after surgery.
secondary_outcome.description: Sputum sounds can be heard or ausculted at the bedside.
Likert 5-level scoring method was adopted to allow patients to evaluate the nursing plan. The higher the score, the more satisfied the patients were.

arm_group.description: The experimental group accepts improved precise aerosol inhalation nursing program，which was based on the traditional oxygen aerosol inhalation treatment, including precise body position care, time control, observation and treatment, evaluation, etc. This group is planned to enroll 100 patients.
The control group accepts traditional aerosol inhalation nursing method. This group is planned to enroll 100 patients.

intervention.description: The precise aerosol inhalation nursing program was based on the traditional oxygen aerosol inhalation treatment, including precise body position care, time control, observation and treatment, evaluation, etc.
The traditional aerosol inhalation nursing method is carried out according to the operation of aerosol inhalation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ①The patient underwent thoracoscopic lung surgery; ②There was no obvious pulmonary infection before the operation; ③Good audiovisual function, no communication barriers, able to cooperate with nebulized inhalation operation; ④Patients informed consent to this study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- ①Patients with mental illness; ②Acute COPD; ③Serious complications or failure of important organs after operation.
